info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 12:38PM PDT until September 21 at 6:45PM PDT by NWS Elko NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following county, Elko.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM PDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Cottonwood Peak Fire. - Cottonwood Peak Fire burn scar is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicken Creek Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PDT THIS EVENING
